meanings.definition: A shallow body of water, especially one connected to the sea.
meanings.sent1: The tourists enjoyed exploring the lagunas along the coast.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen cast their nets into the lagunas to catch fish.
meanings.sent3: The playful seals in the lagunas seemed to be having a water party.
meanings.sent4: The lagunas shimmered like liquid diamonds under the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The lagunas reflected the colors of the sky, creating a beautiful scene.

meanings.definition: A gap or interval in time or space.
meanings.sent1: There was a lagunas in the schedule, so they had time for a quick snack.
meanings.sent2: The lagunas between classes allowed students to relax and chat with friends.
meanings.sent3: The lagunas in the traffic jam gave him a chance to listen to his favorite podcast.
meanings.sent4: The lagunas in the forest felt like stepping into a different world.
meanings.sent5: The lagunas in the conversation made her realize she had missed an important detail.

meanings.definition: A feeling of sluggishness or delay.
meanings.sent1: After lunch, a lagunas settled over him, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent2: The lagunas in his movements indicated he was tired from the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The lagunas in her mind made her forget what she was supposed to do next.
meanings.sent4: The lagunas in the project timeline caused them to miss the deadline.
meanings.sent5: The lagunas in the morning air made it difficult to get out of bed.
